summary: The Sex Pistols, an English punk rock band formed in 1975, had a big impact on music and fashion. They started the punk movement in the UK and inspired many other musicians. Their song "God Save the Queen" was very controversial and got banned from the radio. Their only album, "Never Mind the Bollocks," was a big hit. The band broke up in 1978 but reunited in 1996. They are known for their rebellious image and have been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
title: Sex Pistols
